spatial_accuracy.notes: Major layout mismatch between 2D plan and 3D. Several interior walls are not aligned to the plan (notably the curved/arched partitions in the 3D vs straight walls in 2D) (E2/E5). The plan’s distinct room blocks on the left/top-left and right side do not match the 3D room placement (E2). Main entry on the bottom side is shown as a double door in 2D but becomes a large arched opening without matching door geometry in 3D (E2/E1). Window positions and counts do not correspond closely to the plan (E2/E5). Central living/dining proportions appear significantly altered (over-enlarged) relative to adjacent rooms (E4).

structural_fidelity.notes: Perimeter footprint differs: the 2D plan shows exterior offsets/projections (e.g., small bumps/porch-like extensions) that are not represented; 3D outer shell reads as a simplified rectangle (E1/E2). Multiple walls in 3D are curved where the plan uses orthogonal straight segments (E5). Door embedding/orientation is inconsistent: many 3D doors are placed generically on walls without matching swing-side and exact openings from 2D (E2/E3). Adjacency fidelity is weak (bath/bed/hall relationships appear rearranged) (E2). At least one bathroom/utility space from the 2D is not clearly present as a properly enclosed room in 3D (E1).

furniture_mapping.notes: Furniture does not map cleanly to the plan: 3D includes two dining tables (one near center/top and another at bottom) whereas the plan indicates a single primary dining placement in the central space (E5/E2). Bedroom furnishing and kitchen layout do not follow the plan’s fixture/counter shapes closely (E2). Scale is inconsistent (central furniture appears undersized relative to the enlarged central room) (E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Render is visually clean with coherent materials and decent lighting. Isometric-style camera is acceptable, though reads slightly perspective-biased rather than strictly orthographic/isometric (E6). Geometry is generally clean, but the curved/arched walls and openings introduce stylistic distortions relative to architectural orthogonality (E6/E5). Overall clarity is good.

detected_errors.description: Overall room placement does not match the 2D plan (left/top-left and right-side room blocks appear rearranged in 3D).
Curved/arched interior walls and openings appear in 3D where the 2D plan shows straight orthogonal walls.
Main entrance on bottom side: 2D shows a centered double door; 3D shows a large arched opening without matching door placement/geometry.
Exterior footprint projections/offsets visible in the 2D plan are missing or overly simplified in the 3D perimeter shell.
Interior door locations are inconsistently placed versus the 2D openings (several doors appear shifted to more central wall positions).
Door orientation/swing logic from the 2D plan is not respected in the 3D (generic door placement without correct handedness).
Window placement/count does not correspond to the 2D plan; several windows appear added or relocated on exterior walls.
Hall/partition geometry suggests additional or altered circulation spaces not present in the 2D plan.
At least one bathroom/utility room indicated in the 2D plan is not clearly represented as an enclosed, correctly placed room in the 3D.
Room proportions are distorted: central living/dining area appears disproportionately large compared to surrounding rooms relative to the 2D plan.
Extra dining setup: 3D shows an additional dining table not indicated in the 2D plan.
Camera/projection is not strictly orthographic/isometric; slight perspective feel reduces architectural verification clarity.
